DataElement.preferredName: Multiple Hematopoietic Cell Graft Collection Required Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not multiple hematopoietic cell product (graft) collections were required for the current hematopoietic cell transplant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Multiple Hematopoietic Cell Graft Collection Required
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold. (dictionary.com)_Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Necessary, not optional.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Multiple Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Collection
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
